title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Predictive Modeling of Lung Disease
authors:
Yingbin Liang, Xiqing Liu, Haohao Xia, Yiru Cang, Zitao Zheng,
  Yuanfang Yang
abstract:
In this paper, Pro-HRnet-CNN, an innovative model combining HRNet and
void-convolution techniques, is proposed for disease prediction under lung
imaging. Through the experimental comparison on the authoritative LIDC-IDRI
dataset, we found that compared with the traditional ResNet-50, Pro-HRnet-CNN
showed better performance in the feature extraction and recognition of
small-size nodules, significantly improving the detection accuracy.
Particularly within the domain of detecting smaller targets, the model has
exhibited a remarkable enhancement in accuracy, thereby pioneering an
innovative avenue for the early identification and prognostication of pulmonary
conditions.
